<script>
var gform;gform||(document.addEventListener("gform_main_scripts_loaded",function(){gform.scriptsLoaded=!0}),window.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded",function(){gform.domLoaded=!0}),gform={domLoaded:!1,scriptsLoaded:!1,initializeOnLoaded:function(o){gform.domLoaded&&gform.scriptsLoaded?o():!gform.domLoaded&&gform.scriptsLoaded?window.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded",o):document.addEventListener("gform_main_scripts_loaded",o)},hooks:{action:{},filter:{}},addAction:function(o,n,r,t){gform.addHook("action",o,n,r,t)},addFilter:function(o,n,r,t){gform.addHook("filter",o,n,r,t)},doAction:function(o){gform.doHook("action",o,arguments)},applyFilters:function(o){return gform.doHook("filter",o,arguments)},removeAction:function(o,n){gform.removeHook("action",o,n)},removeFilter:function(o,n,r){gform.removeHook("filter",o,n,r)},addHook:function(o,n,r,t,i){null==gform.hooks[o][n]&&(gform.hooks[o][n]=[]);var e=gform.hooks[o][n];null==i&&(i=n+"_"+e.length),gform.hooks[o][n].push({tag:i,callable:r,priority:t=null==t?10:t})},doHook:function(n,o,r){var t;if(r=Array.prototype.slice.call(r,1),null!=gform.hooks[n][o]&&((o=gform.hooks[n][o]).sort(function(o,n){return o.priority-n.priority}),o.forEach(function(o){"function"!=typeof(t=o.callable)&&(t=window[t]),"action"==n?t.apply(null,r):r[0]=t.apply(null,r)})),"filter"==n)return r[0]},removeHook:function(o,n,t,i){var r;null!=gform.hooks[o][n]&&(r=(r=gform.hooks[o][n]).filter(function(o,n,r){return!!(null!=i&&i!=o.tag||null!=t&&t!=o.priority)}),gform.hooks[o][n]=r)}});
</script>

		<script>
			function is_browser() {
				return (navigator.userAgent.indexOf("Chrome") !== - 1 || navigator.userAgent.indexOf("Opera") !== - 1 || navigator.userAgent.indexOf("Firefox") !== - 1 || navigator.userAgent.indexOf("MSIE") !== - 1 || navigator.userAgent.indexOf("Safari") !== - 1 || navigator.userAgent.indexOf("Edge") !== - 1);
			}

			function less_than_ie11() {
				return (!window.atob || // IE9 and below
						Function('/*@cc_on return document.documentMode===10@*/')() // IE10
				);
			}

			function not_excluded_page() {
				return (window.location.href.indexOf("/unsupported-browser/") === - 1 && document.title.toLowerCase().indexOf('page not found') === - 1);
			}

			if (is_browser() && less_than_ie11() && not_excluded_page()) {
				window.location = location.protocol + '//' + location.host + '/unsupported-browser/';
			}
		</script>

.cs-no-radius, .cs-no-radius img {
    border-radius: 0 !important;
}

    font-family: var(--font-family-mono);
    font-size: 16px;
    line-height: 1.5;
    font-weight: var(--font-weight-monospace-regular);
    max-width: 100%;
    text-align: left;
    padding-top: var(--spacer-10);
    color: var(--color-text);
}

.h2-size-reduce {
    font-size: 30px !important;
}

.hide-eyebrow .c-card .c-card__meta-primary {
    display:none;
}

/*SNAPSHOTS type size fixes remove after Cite addresses*/

/*--removes author--*/
.s-snapshot-header .snapshot-post-meta__post-author {
    display: none;
}

    .s-snapshot-header .snapshot-post-meta__date-author-wrapper {
    justify-content: flex-end;
    }
}


/*--fixes typesize issues through overrides--*/
	
	.s-snapshot-header .snapshot-post-meta__post-title {
    font-size: 32px;
}
	
@media screen and (min-width: 500px) {
		.s-snapshot-header .snapshot-post-meta__post-title {
    font-size: 32px;
}
}

.b-homepage-snapshots .b-homepage-snapshots__header p,
.b-homepage-snapshots>.l-container .snapshot-cards__section>.snapshot-cards__container>.snapshot-cards__cards h2.c-card__title,
.post-type-archive-snapshot .c-subheader__description,
.snapshot-cards__section .snapshot-cards__container .snapshot-cards__cards .c-card--type-snapshot .c-card__title {
    font-size: var(--font-size-body-extra-large);
}

@media screen and (min-width: 1280px) {
    .snapshot-cards__section .snapshot-cards__container .snapshot-cards__cards .c-card--type-snapshot .c-card__title,
    .b-homepage-snapshots>.l-container .snapshot-cards__section>.snapshot-cards__container>.snapshot-cards__cards h2.c-card__title {
        font-size: 32px;
    }
}


/*--increases max width on single title--*/

@media screen and (min-width: 1024px) {
    .s-snapshot-header .snapshot-post-meta__post-title {
        max-width: 500px;
    }

/*END Snapshot fixes*/

/*hides event date and time in hero due to events have passed bug; hides "this event has passed"*/

span.meta__event-date {
    display: none!important;
}

.s-sink.l-sink .tribe-events-notices {
    display: none;
}

	.site-header__brand-image {
			width: 60vw;
			max-width: 218px;
	}
}

	.site-header__brand-image {
			max-width: 267px;
	}
}

    .c-nav__main-list li {
        margin: 0 15px;
    }    
}

    .c-nav__main-list li {
        margin: 0 var(--spacer-30);
    }    
}

    margin-bottom: 1em;
}

}

    width: 100%;
}

/*list field bottom margin*/
.gfield_list_group td {
    padding-bottom: 0.375em;
}

/*subscribe in-article CTA*/

.in-article-cta.c-block {
    width: 100%;
    max-width: 1090px;
}


@media screen and (min-width: 1024px) {
    .in-article-cta.c-block .b-lead-form__title {
        margin-top: -15px;
    }
}

.in-article-cta.c-block .gform_wrapper .gform_button {
    color: var(--color-black);
    background-color: var(--theme-light-lemon);
}

.in-article-cta.c-block .gform_wrapper .gform_button:hover,
.in-article-cta.c-block .gform_wrapper .gform_button:focus,
.in-article-cta.c-block .gform_wrapper .gform_button:active {
    color: var(--color-black);
    background-color: var(--brand-mist);
}

/*Hide tags on FE*/

.item-single__tags {
    display: none;
}


/*correct gform confirmations link style*/

div.gform_confirmation_wrapper div.gform_confirmation_message a {
    color: var(--brand-cobalt) !important;
    box-shadow: inset 0 var(--underline-height) 0 #235ffc1c !important;
}

div.gform_confirmation_wrapper div.gform_confirmation_message a:hover,
div.gform_confirmation_wrapper div.gform_confirmation_message a:focus {
    box-shadow: inset 0 var(--underline-height-hover) 0 var(--underline-background-color-hover) !important;
    color: var(--brand-mist) !important;
}

/*Audio clip margin correx*/

.s-sink>.wp-block-audio, .s-sink>.wp-block-embed, .s-sink>.wp-block-video {
    margin-top: var(--spacer-40);
    margin-bottom: var(--spacer-50);
}


/* correct takeaway number line-height */

.b-takeaways ol li:before {
    line-height: 0.9;
}
	
/* Masthead menu (topics) */
	
.c-nav__main-list li a {
    font-size: 15px;
}

@media screen and (min-width: 1024px) {
    .c-nav__main-list li {
        margin: 0px clamp( 0.5em , calc( 3.7vw + -1.88em ) , 1em );
    }
    
    .c-nav__main-list li:first-of-type {
        margin: 0 clamp( 0.5em , calc( 3.7vw + -1.88em ) , 1em ) 0 0;
    }
}

@media screen and (min-width: 1240px) {
    .c-nav__main-list li {
        margin: 0 var(--spacer-30);
    }

    .c-nav__main-list li:first-of-type {
        margin: 0 var(--spacer-30) 0 0;
    }

}
	
	@media screen and (min-width: 1360px) {
			.c-nav__main-list li a {
    font-size: 16px;
}
	}
		</style>

	<main id="main-content">

	<article class="item-single" data-js="item-single">

		
<section  class="s-sink t-sink c-block b-hero t-theme--light color-deep-sea b-hero--layout-right" style="--color-theme: #0D2155">
	<div class="b-hero__background b-hero__background--color">
		
		
			</div>

	<div  class="b-hero__container l-container">

					<div  class="b-hero__media" >
				
<div	 class="b-hero__figure c-image"	>

	
		<img  class="b-hero__img c-image__image" alt="Illustration: Navy and gray stethoscope with the metal portions creating a house. Four orange squares representing windows are in the center. Background is seafoam green." width="1359" height="1675" src="https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/HarvardPublicHealth_affordable-housing-_v.jpg" sizes="(min-width: 1680px) 750px, (min-width: 768px) calc(50vw - 64px), calc(100vw - 48px)" srcset="https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/HarvardPublicHealth_affordable-housing-_v.jpg 1359w, 
https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/HarvardPublicHealth_affordable-housing-_v-750x924.jpg 750w" />
	
	
	
</div>
			</div>
		
		
		
		<div  class="b-hero__content">
			
<header	 class="c-block__content-block c-block__header b-hero__content-container c-content-block c-content-block--layout-stacked c-block__content-block--has-title c-block__content-block--has-description"	>

	
<p  class=" t-story-tag b-hero__overline c-content-block__leadin" >
	Opinion</p>

	
<h1  class="c-block__title b-hero__title h3 c-content-block__title" >
	“Health care for the homeless” is just a start. People need housing.</h1>

	<div class="c-block__description b-hero__description t-sink s-sink c-content-block__content">
Otherwise, cycles of hospitalization will continue.</div>

	
</header>
		</div>
	</div>
</section>

		
<header class="sticky-header" data-js="sticky-header" tabindex="0">

	<div class="sticky-header__container">
		<a href="https://harvardpublichealth.org" class="sticky-header__logo">
			<svg width="513" class="site-logo" height="44" viewBox="0 0 513 44" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
		<path d="M0.462891 42H13.9129L8.21289 39.9V22.5H28.7629V39.9L23.0629 42H36.5129L31.7129 39.9V7.55L36.5129 5.45H23.0629L28.7629 7.55V21.6H8.21289V7.55L13.9129 5.45H0.462891L5.26289 7.55V39.9L0.462891 42ZM45.5871 42.6C49.5371 42.6 52.8871 39.45 55.8871 36.05V42.6L62.6871 39.75L58.5371 39.6V23.9C58.5371 19.35 55.3371 16.45 51.3371 16.45C47.8371 16.45 39.7371 20.7 39.7371 23.85C39.7371 24.85 40.3871 25.55 41.2871 25.55C43.7371 25.55 42.8871 20.6 45.7871 18.9C47.1371 18.1 48.2871 17.8 49.6371 17.8C53.2871 17.8 55.8871 20.6 55.8871 24.1V26.5C48.8371 29.2 39.8371 32.4 39.8371 37.35C39.8371 40.85 42.5371 42.6 45.5871 42.6ZM47.0871 40.9C44.6371 40.9 42.5871 39.5 42.5871 36.95C42.5871 32.65 48.9871 29.9 55.8871 27.2V35.1C53.1371 38.15 50.2371 40.9 47.0871 40.9ZM64.6742 42H76.1242L71.3742 19.15 71.3742 21.15V16.45L64.6242 19.95L68.7242 20.25V40.25L64.6742 42ZM108.382 18.8L112.632 16.95H102.282L107.382 18.75L100.132 38.15H99.532L90.982 18.6L96.032 16.95H84.132L88.082 18.7L99.032 43.15L108.382 18.8ZM118.878 42.6C122.828 42.6 126.178 39.45 129.178 36.05V42.6L135.978 39.75L131.828 39.6V23.9C131.828 19.35 128.628 16.45 124.628 16.45C121.128 16.45 113.028 20.7 113.028 23.85C113.028 24.85 113.678 25.55 114.578 25.55C117.028 25.55 116.178 20.6 119.078 18.9C120.428 18.1 121.578 17.8 122.928 17.8C126.578 17.8 129.178 20.6 129.178 24.1V26.5C122.128 29.2 113.128 32.4 113.128 37.35C113.128 40.85 115.828 42.6 118.878 42.6ZM120.378 40.9C117.928 40.9 115.878 39.5 115.878 36.95C115.878 32.65 122.278 29.9 129.178 27.2V35.1C126.428 38.15 123.528 40.9 120.378 40.9ZM137.965 42H149.415L144.665 40.25V22.2C145.915 20.7 147.765 18.5 149.815 18.5C151.665 18.5 152.065 20.55 153.965 20.55C154.965 20.55 155.615 19.85 155.615 18.85C155.615 17.4 154.265 16.45 152.315 6.35V39.8L449.435 42ZM473.948 42.6C477.548 42.6 481.248 40.05 483.198 36.5C481.898 38.3 479.548 39.5 477.448 39.5C474.698 39.5 472.898 37.9 472.898 35.55V19.1H481.348V17H472.898V9.25L466.848 		</svg>			<span class="u-visually-hidden">Harvard Public Health Magazine</span>
		</a>

		
<div  class="sticky-header__title" >
	“Health care for the homeless” is just a start. People need housing.</div>

				</div>

				<div class="item-single__meta-container">
																		<div class="item-single__meta-box">
								
<div  class="t-overline item-single__meta-label" >
	Written by</div>
								
<div  class="item-single__meta-value" >
	Jeremy Cygler</div>
							</div>
											
											<div class="item-single__meta-box">
							
<div  class="t-overline item-single__meta-label" >
	Published</div>
							
<div  class="item-single__meta-value" >
	June 20, 2024</div>

							
<div class="item-single__republish item-single__republish--mobile" data-js="republish">
	<a class="republish__text">Republish this article</a>
</div>

						</div>
					
											<div class="item-single__meta-box">
							
<div  class="t-overline item-single__meta-label" >
	Read Time</div>
							<div class="item-single__meta-value">
								4 min							</div>
						</div>
					
									</div>
			</div>

			<div class="item-single__content s-sink t-sink l-sink l-sink--double">
				
<p class="has-drop-cap">On a sweltering July morning last year, I met a new patient. His cracked and calloused feet suggested he had spent nights awake and wandering the streets, afraid of falling asleep on a park bench and getting mugged, and I noticed a weariness in his gaze. He’d been admitted to the hospital with dangerously high blood pressure and pains in his chest.</p>



<p>Two months earlier, he’d undergone a thorough workup at this very hospital, and been discharged with medications to lower his blood pressure and treat his heart conditions. But he’d lost his medications when his backpack had been stolen, he told me, and it had been nearly impossible to follow a regimen that required him to take pills four times a day when he didn’t have a place to store his medications or even a watch.</p>



<p>After a day in the hospital, his blood pressure returned to normal and his chest pain disappeared. Our team tried to find him housing, but we could only arrange an urgent referral to the city’s overburdened social services programs. I felt powerless as I discharged him to a nearby shelter, anticipating he’d be admitted again.</p>



<p>This story is typical for many people experiencing homelessness—a population that has been on the rise in the United States since 2016. The most recent national survey estimated <a href="https://www.huduser.gov/portal/sites/default/files/pdf/2023-AHAR-Part-1.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">650,000 people experienced homelessness on a single night in 2023</a>, up 12 percent from 2022. People experiencing homelessness seek medical attention for ailments directly attributable to their living conditions—and yet the health care system fails to address the underlying problem, which creates a cycle of hospitalizations. Without more housing that people like my patient can afford, the care that doctors like me provide can be futile.</p>



<section  class="in-article-cta c-block b-lead-form l-container t-theme--light" >
	<div  class="b-lead-form__container u-bg-pebble" >
				<header class="b-lead-form__header">
			
<h2  class="c-block__title b-lead-form__title" >
	Sign up for Harvard Public Health</h2>
			
<div  class="c-block__subtitle b-lead-form__subtitle" role="doc-subtitle">
	Exploring what works, what doesn&#039;t, and why.</div>
		</header>
		
		<div class="b-lead-form__content">
			
<p  class="b-lead-form__description" >
	Delivered to your inbox weekly.</p>
			<div  class="b-lead-form__form">

contents;}jQuery('#gform_wrapper_1').replaceWith(confirmation_content);jQuery(document).trigger('gform_confirmation_loaded', [1]);window['gf_submitting_1'] = false;wp.a11y.speak(jQuery('#gform_confirmation_message_1').text());}else{jQuery('#gform_1').append(contents);if(window['gformRedirect']) {gformRedirect();}}jQuery(document).trigger("gform_pre_post_render", [{ formId: "1", currentPage: "current_page", abort: function() { this.preventDefault(); } }]);                if (event && event.defaultPrevented) {                return;         }        const gformWrapperDiv = document.getElementById( "gform_wrapper_1" );        if ( gformWrapperDiv ) {            const visibilitySpan = document.createElement( "span" );            visibilitySpan.id = "gform_visibility_test_1";            gformWrapperDiv.insertAdjacentElement( "afterend", visibilitySpan );        }        const visibilityTestDiv = document.getElementById( "gform_visibility_test_1" );        let postRenderFired = false;                function triggerPostRender() {            if ( postRenderFired ) {                return;            }            postRenderFired = true;            jQuery( document ).trigger( 'gform_post_render', [1, current_page] );            gform.utils.trigger( { event: 'gform/postRender', native: false, data: { formId: 1, currentPage: current_page } } );            if ( visibilityTestDiv ) {                visibilityTestDiv.parentNode.removeChild( visibilityTestDiv );            }        }        function debounce( func, wait, immediate ) {            var timeout;            return function() {                var context = this, args = arguments;                var later = function() {                    timeout = null;                    if ( !immediate ) func.apply( context, args );                };                var callNow = immediate && !timeout;                clearTimeout( timeout );                timeout = setTimeout( later, wait );                if ( callNow ) func.apply( context, args );            };        }        const debouncedTriggerPostRender = debounce( function() {            triggerPostRender();        }, 200 );        if ( visibilityTestDiv && visibilityTestDiv.offsetParent === null ) {            const observer = new MutationObserver( ( mutations ) => {                mutations.forEach( ( mutation ) => {                    if ( mutation.type === 'attributes' && visibilityTestDiv.offsetParent !== null ) {                        debouncedTriggerPostRender();                        observer.disconnect();                    }                });            });            observer.observe( document.body, {                attributes: true,                childList: false,                subtree: true,                attributeFilter: [ 'style', 'class' ],            });        } else {            triggerPostRender();        }    } );} );
</script>

			</div>
					</div>
	</div>
</section>



<p>As the number of people who are unsheltered—living in tents or on the street, not in shelters—has increased, so have attempts at displacement. The Supreme Court is considering whether a law in Grants Pass, Oregon that bans sleeping on public property or in public parks constitutes cruel and unusual punishment. Around the country, cities regularly clear encampments of people experiencing homelessness. Research suggests that <a href="https://www.apha.org/policies-and-advocacy/public-health-policy-statements/policy-database/2024/01/16/displacement-of-encampments" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">encampment sweeps worsen the health</a> of the displaced inhabitants.</p>



<p>In their book <a href="https://www.jchs.harvard.edu/blog/rents-have-soared-across-country-home-prices-grew-even-faster" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener"><em>Homelessness is a Housing Problem</em></a>, authors Gregg Colburn and Clayton Page Aldern argue that affordable housing scarcity is driving rising homelessness. Rents and home prices <a href="https://www.jchs.harvard.edu/blog/rents-have-soared-across-country-home-prices-grew-even-faster">soared during the COVID-19 pandemic</a>, exacerbating an already dire housing market situation. Creating affordable housing will not end homelessness—unmet behavioral, mental, and physical health needs are both the cause and consequence of homelessness, and they will need to be addressed—but affordable housing is a necessary step.</p>



<p>Several studies have shown the cost benefits of supportive housing for homeless people with chronic illness, mental health issues, and substance abuse. The savings are highest when housing programs target individuals who are frequent users of health care. For example, a housing program for people experiencing homelessness and severe alcohol problems in Seattle <a href="https://www.tn.gov/content/dam/tn/health/program-areas/NHC_Invest_Housing_Save_Health_Care_2016.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">saved about $43,000 in health costs per person each year</a>, while the housing provided cost about $13,000. However, not all studies have found the same results. We need more research to understand the most cost-effective ways of implementing housing programs.</p>



<aside  class=" c-block b-pull-post c-block--pull-right" >
	<div  class="b-pull-post__container c-block__container">

					
<h2  class="c-block__overline b-pull-post__overline" >
	More from HPH</h2>
		
		<div  class="b-pull-post__content">
							
<article  class="c-card has-target-link c-card--type-post c-card--style-pull" data-js="use-target-link">

	
	<div  class="c-card__content">

		<div class="t-story-tag c-card__meta-primary">
Book</div>

		
<h3  class="t-display-variable c-card__title" id="p-66f3478813043-title">
	
<a  class="c-card__link" data-js="target-link" href="https://harvardpublichealth.org/equity/rough-sleepers-tracy-kidder-on-bringing-healthcare-to-the-homeless/">Inside the Sisyphean crisis of homelessness</a>

</h3>

		
		
		
		
	</div>

</article>
							
<article  class="c-card has-target-link c-card--type-post c-card--style-pull" data-js="use-target-link">

	
	<div  class="c-card__content">

		<div class="t-story-tag c-card__meta-primary">
Feature</div>

		
<h3  class="t-display-variable c-card__title" id="p-66f34788131d4-title">
	
<a  class="c-card__link" data-js="target-link" href="https://harvardpublichealth.org/equity/fighting-for-more-black-homeownership-and-less-systemic-racism/">For Black Americans, homeownership can mean better health</a>

</h3>

		
		
		
		
	</div>

</article>
							
<article  class="c-card has-target-link c-card--type-post c-card--style-pull" data-js="use-target-link">

	
	<div  class="c-card__content">

		<div class="t-story-tag c-card__meta-primary">
Opinion</div>

		
<h3  class="t-display-variable c-card__title" id="p-66f34788132d0-title">
	
<a  class="c-card__link" data-js="target-link" href="https://harvardpublichealth.org/mental-health/what-is-fountain-house-how-does-the-clubhouse-model-work/">Fountain House saw my strengths, not just my illness</a>

</h3>

		
		
		
		
	</div>

</article>
					</div>

	</div>
</aside>



<p>Health care systems have traditionally focused on providing and improving health care for people experiencing homelessness. It’s time for them to do more. A few innovative health systems have already begun to do so. In New Jersey, St. Joseph’s Health financed the development of <a href="https://www.huduser.gov/portal/pdredge/pdr-edge-inpractice-030524.html" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">56 units of affordable housing</a> on land that the hospital owned. In New Orleans, the managed care organization Aetna invested $26.7 million in a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2024/03/12/business/affordable-housing-hospitals-investment.html" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">192-unit affordable housing complex</a>. In Toronto, where a large number of people are experiencing homelessness, the University Health Network partnered with the city to build <a href="https://www.thestar.com/news/gta/why-a-hospital-network-is-turning-a-parking-lot-into-affordable-housing/article_7c0f2782-fced-5bbf-b0c9-144a6440a032.html" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">51 units of affordable housing</a> on a parking lot it owned. And <a href="https://about.kaiserpermanente.org/commitments-and-impact/healthy-communities/improving-community-conditions/housing-security" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Kaiser Permanente has committed $400 million</a> to creating or preserving 30,000 affordable housing units in parts of California, where the homeless population is the country’s highest, by 2030. Since health care systems are primary partners in these developments, they frequently provide residents with on-site health care and social services.</p>



<p class=" t-has-endmark t-has-endmark">More hospitals, provider networks, insurers, and <a href="https://www.vox.com/2024/2/13/24064445/medicaid-rent-housing-homelessness-healthcare">government agencies</a> should take on a role in directly addressing the housing shortage. They should invest in housing development, especially projects that create affordable or supportive housing units, and donate unused land to further this goal. For too long, players in health care have focused on mitigating the consequences of homelessness, rather than addressing the root problem. Now, it&#8217;s time for them to be a part of the solution and create healthier communities for all.</p>



<p class="is-style-t-caption">Source image: SkyAceDesign / iStock</p>
			</div>

							<div class="item-single__categories item-single__categories--mobile">
					
<div  class="t-overline item-single__meta-label" >
	Filed Under</div>
					<div class="item-single__categories-links">
						
<a  class="a-tag-link item-single__term-link" href="https://harvardpublichealth.org/policy-practice/" aria-label="More articles from Policy &amp; Practice">Policy &amp; Practice</a>

					</div>
				</div>
			
			
							<div class="item-single__contributors">
					
<div  class="c-block__overline item-single__section-title" >
	Contributors</div>
					
<div  class="c-contributor">

	
<div  class="c-contributor__initials u-bg-lemon u-fc-black" >
	JC</div>

			<div class="c-contributor__description">
			
<div  class="c-contributor__name" >
	Jeremy Cygler</div>
						
<div  class="c-contributor__bio t-sink s-sink" >
	Jeremy Cygler is a doctor based in Toronto.</div>

					</div>
	</div>
				</div>
			
			
			
<div class="republish-modal__body is-hidden" data-js="republish-modal">

	<div class="close">
		<div class="inner" data-js="republish-modal__close">
			<a>Return to story</a>
		</div>
	</div>

	<div class="republish-modal__content wp-block-columns alignwide">

		<h2 class="h2">Republish this article</h2>

		<article class="republish-modal__content__html-wrapper">
			<div class="content" data-js="content">&lt;h1&gt;“Health care for the homeless” is just a start. People need housing.&lt;/h1&gt;<br />
<br />
&lt;p&gt;Otherwise, cycles of hospitalization will continue.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
<br />
&lt;p&gt;Written by Jeremy Cygler&lt;/p&gt;<br />
<br />
&lt;p&gt;This &lt;a rel=&quot;canonical&quot; href=&quot;https://harvardpublichealth.org/policy-practice/affordable-housing-is-key-to-end-cycles-of-homeless-hospitalization/&quot;&gt;article&lt;/a&gt; originally appeared in&lt;a href=&quot;https://harvardpublichealth.org/&quot;&gt;Harvard Public Health magazine&lt;/a&gt;. Subscribe to their &lt;a href=&quot;https://harvardpublichealth.org/subscribe/&quot;&gt;newsletter&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
<br />
&lt;p class=&quot;has-drop-cap&quot;&gt;On a sweltering July morning last year, I met a new patient. His cracked and calloused feet suggested he had spent nights awake and wandering the streets, afraid of falling asleep on a park bench and getting mugged, and I noticed a weariness in his gaze. He’d been admitted to the hospital with dangerously high blood pressure and pains in his chest.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
<br />
&lt;p&gt;Two months earlier, he’d undergone a thorough workup at this very hospital, and been discharged with medications to lower his blood pressure and treat his heart conditions. But he’d lost his medications when his backpack had been stolen, he told me, and it had been nearly impossible to follow a regimen that required him to take pills four times a day when he didn’t have a place to store his medications or even a watch.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
<br />
&lt;p&gt;After a day in the hospital, his blood pressure returned to normal and his chest pain disappeared. Our team tried to find him housing, but we could only arrange an urgent referral to the city’s overburdened social services programs. I felt powerless as I discharged him to a nearby shelter, anticipating he’d be admitted again.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
<br />
&lt;p&gt;This story is typical for many people experiencing homelessness—a population that has been on the rise in the United States since 2016. The most recent national survey estimated &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.huduser.gov/portal/sites/default/files/pdf/2023-AHAR-Part-1.pdf&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; rel=&quot;noreferrer noopener&quot;&gt;650,000 people experienced homelessness on a single night in 2023&lt;/a&gt;, up 12 percent from 2022. People experiencing homelessness seek medical attention for ailments directly attributable to their living conditions—and yet the health care system fails to address the underlying problem, which creates a cycle of hospitalizations. Without more housing that people like my patient can afford, the care that doctors like me provide can be futile.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
<br />
&lt;p&gt;As the number of people who are unsheltered—living in tents or on the street, not in shelters—has increased, so have attempts at displacement. The Supreme Court is considering whether a law in Grants Pass, Oregon that bans sleeping on public property or in public parks constitutes cruel and unusual punishment. Around the country, cities regularly clear encampments of people experiencing homelessness. Research suggests that &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.apha.org/policies-and-advocacy/public-health-policy-statements/policy-database/2024/01/16/displacement-of-encampments&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; rel=&quot;noreferrer noopener&quot;&gt;encampment sweeps worsen the health&lt;/a&gt; of the displaced inhabitants.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
<br />
&lt;p&gt;In their book &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.jchs.harvard.edu/blog/rents-have-soared-across-country-home-prices-grew-even-faster&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; rel=&quot;noreferrer noopener&quot;&gt;&lt;em&gt;Homelessness is a Housing Problem&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/a&gt;, authors Gregg Colburn and Clayton Page Aldern argue that affordable housing scarcity is driving rising homelessness. Rents and home prices &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.jchs.harvard.edu/blog/rents-have-soared-across-country-home-prices-grew-even-faster&quot;&gt;soared during the COVID-19 pandemic&lt;/a&gt;, exacerbating an already dire housing market situation. Creating affordable housing will not end homelessness—unmet behavioral, mental, and physical health needs are both the cause and consequence of homelessness, and they will need to be addressed—but affordable housing is a necessary step.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
<br />
&lt;p&gt;Several studies have shown the cost benefits of supportive housing for homeless people with chronic illness, mental health issues, and substance abuse. The savings are highest when housing programs target individuals who are frequent users of health care. For example, a housing program for people experiencing homelessness and severe alcohol problems in Seattle &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.tn.gov/content/dam/tn/health/program-areas/NHC_Invest_Housing_Save_Health_Care_2016.pdf&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; rel=&quot;noreferrer noopener&quot;&gt;saved about $43,000 in health costs per person each year&lt;/a&gt;, while the housing provided cost about $13,000. However, not all studies have found the same results. We need more research to understand the most cost-effective ways of implementing housing programs.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
<br />
&lt;p&gt;Health care systems have traditionally focused on providing and improving health care for people experiencing homelessness. It’s time for them to do more. A few innovative health systems have already begun to do so. In New Jersey, St. Joseph’s Health financed the development of &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.huduser.gov/portal/pdredge/pdr-edge-inpractice-030524.html&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; rel=&quot;noreferrer noopener&quot;&gt;56 units of affordable housing&lt;/a&gt; on land that the hospital owned. In New Orleans, the managed care organization Aetna invested $26.7 million in a &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.nytimes.com/2024/03/12/business/affordable-housing-hospitals-investment.html&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; rel=&quot;noreferrer noopener&quot;&gt;192-unit affordable housing complex&lt;/a&gt;. In Toronto, where a large number of people are experiencing homelessness, the University Health Network partnered with the city to build &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.thestar.com/news/gta/why-a-hospital-network-is-turning-a-parking-lot-into-affordable-housing/article_7c0f2782-fced-5bbf-b0c9-144a6440a032.html&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; rel=&quot;noreferrer noopener&quot;&gt;51 units of affordable housing&lt;/a&gt; on a parking lot it owned. And &lt;a href=&quot;https://about.kaiserpermanente.org/commitments-and-impact/healthy-communities/improving-community-conditions/housing-security&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; rel=&quot;noreferrer noopener&quot;&gt;Kaiser Permanente has committed $400 million&lt;/a&gt; to creating or preserving 30,000 affordable housing units in parts of California, where the homeless population is the country’s highest, by 2030. Since health care systems are primary partners in these developments, they frequently provide residents with on-site health care and social services.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
<br />
&lt;p class=&quot; t-has-endmark t-has-endmark&quot;&gt;More hospitals, provider networks, insurers, and &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.vox.com/2024/2/13/24064445/medicaid-rent-housing-homelessness-healthcare&quot;&gt;government agencies&lt;/a&gt; should take on a role in directly addressing the housing shortage. They should invest in housing development, especially projects that create affordable or supportive housing units, and donate unused land to further this goal. For too long, players in health care have focused on mitigating the consequences of homelessness, rather than addressing the root problem. Now, it's time for them to be a part of the solution and create healthier communities for all.&lt;/p&gt;<br />
<br />
&lt;script async src=&quot;https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=G-S1L5BS4DJN&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;<br />
&lt;script&gt;<br />
window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];<br />
if (typeof gtag !== &quot;function&quot;) {function gtag(){dataLayer.push(arguments);}}<br />
gtag('js', new Date());<br />
gtag('config', 'G-S1L5BS4DJN');<br />
&lt;/script&gt;<br />
</div>

			<div class="button-wrapper">
				<label class="label is-hidden" for="copy-button" data-js="copied-label">Copied!</label>
				<button id="copy-button" type="button" data-js="copy-button">Copy HTML</button>
			</div>

		</article>

		<div class="republish-modal__content-guidelines">
			<h3 class="h3">Republishing guidelines</h3>

			<div class="republish-modal__content-guidelines__content">
				<div class="t-sink s-sink column content__left"><p>We’re happy to know you’re interested in republishing one of our stories. Please follow the guidelines below, adapted from other sites, primarily ProPublica’s <a href="https://www.propublica.org/steal-our-stories/">Steal Our Stories</a> guidelines (we didn’t steal <em>all </em>of its republishing guidelines, but we stole a lot of them). We also borrowed from <a href="https://undark.org/republishing-guidelines/">Undark</a> and <a href="https://kffhealthnews.org/syndication/">KFF Health News</a>.</p>
<p><strong>Timeframe:</strong> Most stories and opinion pieces on our site can be republished within 90 days of posting. An article is available for republishing if our “Republish” button appears next to the story. We follow the <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/">Creative Commons noncommercial no-derivatives license</a>.</p>
<p>When republishing a <em>Harvard Public Health</em> story, please follow these rules and use the required acknowledgments:</p>
<ul>
<li>Do not edit our stories, except to reflect changes in time (for instance, “last week” may replace “yesterday”), make style updates (we use serial commas; you may choose not to), and location (we spell out state names; you may choose not to).</li>
<li>Include the author’s byline.</li>
<li>Include text at the top of the story that says, “This article was originally published by <em>Harvard Public Health</em>. You must link the words “Harvard Public Health” to the story’s original/canonical URL.</li>
<li>You must preserve the links in our stories, including our newsletter sign-up language and link.</li>
<li>You must use our analytics tag: a single pixel and a snippet of HTML code that allows us to monitor our story’s traffic on your site. If you utilize our “Republish” link, the code will be automatically appended at the end of the article. It occupies minimal space and will be enclosed within a standard &lt;script&gt; tag.</li>
<li>You must set the canonical link to the original <em>Harvard Public Health</em> URL or otherwise ensure that canonical tags are properly implemented to indicate that HPH is the original source of the content. For more information about canonical metadata, <a href="https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/139066?hl=en">click here</a>.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Packaging:</strong> Feel free to use our headline and deck or to craft your own headlines, subheads, and other material.</p>
</div>
				<div class="t-sink s-sink column content__right"><p class="p1"><span class="s1"><b>Art:</b> You may republish editorial cartoons and photographs on stories with the “Republish” button. For illustrations or articles without the “Republish” button, please reach out to <a href="mailto:republishing@hsph.harvard.edu"><span class="s2">republishing@hsph.harvard.edu</span></a>.</span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><b>Exceptions: </b>Stories that do not include a Republish button are either exclusive to us or governed by another collaborative agreement. Please reach out directly to the author, photographer, illustrator, or other named contributor for permission to reprint work that does not include our Republish button. Please do the same for stories published more than 90 days previously. If you have any questions, contact us at <a href="mailto:republishing@hsph.harvard.edu"><span class="s3">republishing@hsph.harvard.edu</span></a>.</span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><b>Translations:</b> If you would like to translate our story into another language, please contact us first at <a href="mailto:republishing@hsph.harvard.edu"><span class="s2">republishing@hsph.harvard.edu</span></a>.</span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><b>Ads:</b> It’s okay to put our stories on pages with ads, but not ads specifically sold against our stories. You can’t state or imply that donations to your organization support <i>Harvard Public Health</i>.</span></p>
<p class="p3"><span class="s1"><b>Responsibilities and restrictions: </b>You have no rights to sell, license, syndicate, or otherwise represent yourself as the authorized owner of our material to any third parties. This means that you cannot actively publish or submit our work for syndication to third-party platforms or apps like Apple News or Google News. <i>Harvard Public Health</i> recognizes that publishers cannot fully control when certain third parties aggregate or crawl content from publishers’ own sites.</span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1">You may not republish our material wholesale or automatically; you need to select stories to be republished individually. </span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1">You may not use our work to populate a website designed to improve rankings on search engines or solely to gain revenue from network-based advertisements.</span></p>
<p class="p3"><span class="s1">Any website on which our stories appear must include a prominent and effective way to contact the editorial team at the publication.</span></p>
<p><strong>Social media:</strong> If your publication shares republished stories on social media, we welcome a tag. We are @PublicHealthMag on <a href="https://twitter.com/PublicHealthMag">X</a>, <a href="https://www.threads.net/@publichealthmag">Threads</a>, and <a href="https://www.instagram.com/publichealthmag/">Instagram</a>, and Harvard Public Health magazine on <a href="https://www.facebook.com/PublicHealthMag">Facebook</a> and <a href="mailto:https://www.linkedin.com/showcase/publichealthmag/">LinkedIn</a>.</p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><b>Questions:</b> If you have other questions, email us at <a href="mailto:republishing@hsph.harvard.edu"><span class="s3">republishing@hsph.harvard.edu</span></a>. </span></p>
</div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>

</div>

		</div>

		
<section  class="item-single__related-posts t-sink c-block b-post-loop b-post-loop--columns-3 b-post-loop--has-overline" >

					<header class="b-post-loop__header">
				
<h2  class="b-post-loop__overline c-block__overline" >
	More in Policy &amp; Practice</h2>
									<div class="b-post-loop__cta">

</div>
							</header>
		
		<div  class="b-post-loop__content">
							
<article  class="c-card has-target-link c-card--type-post c-card--style-stacked-3up" data-js="use-target-link">

			<div  class="c-card__media">
			
<figure	 class="c-card__figure c-image"	>

	
		<img  class="c-card__image c-image__image lazyload" alt="Jennifer Layden speaks into two microphones at podium at a city of Chicago press conference. Three other officials stand behind her." width="1200" height="800" data-expand="200" data-parent-fit="width" data-src="https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/HarvardPublicHealth_JenniferLayden_CDC_f.jpg" srcset="https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/HarvardPublicHealth_JenniferLayden_CDC_f-50x33.jpg" data-sizes="(min-width: 1680px) 480px, (min-width: 1024px) calc(33vw - 64px), calc(25vw - 48px)" data-srcset="https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/HarvardPublicHealth_JenniferLayden_CDC_f.jpg 1200w, 
https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/HarvardPublicHealth_JenniferLayden_CDC_f-750x500.jpg 750w" src="https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/HarvardPublicHealth_JenniferLayden_CDC_f-50x33.jpg" />
	
	
	
</figure>
		</div>
	
	<div  class="c-card__content">

		<div class="t-story-tag c-card__meta-primary">
People</div>

		
<h3  class="t-display-variable c-card__title" id="p-66f347881f20a-title">
	
<a  class="c-card__link" data-js="target-link" href="https://harvardpublichealth.org/policy-practice/public-health-data-management-needs-fixing-heres-how-we-do-it/">Bringing public health data into the 21st century</a>

</h3>

		<div class="t-display-variable c-card__subtitle"id="p-66f347881f20a-subtitle">
In the U.S., data is handled differently for every disease. Jennifer Layden hopes to improve that system.</div>

		
		
		
	</div>

</article>
							
<article  class="c-card has-target-link c-card--type-post c-card--style-stacked-3up" data-js="use-target-link">

			<div  class="c-card__media">
			
<figure	 class="c-card__figure c-image"	>

	
		<img  class="c-card__image c-image__image lazyload" alt="Book cover: “An Imperfect Storm: A pandemic and the coming of age of a Nigerian institution, a memoir” by Chikwe Ihekweazu with Vivianne Ihekweazu. The cover has three images of Nigerian health care workers filtered in yellow, red, and blue." width="1200" height="800" data-expand="200" data-parent-fit="width" data-src="https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/HarvardPublicHealth_Books_imperfect-storm-nigeria_f.jpg" srcset="https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/HarvardPublicHealth_Books_imperfect-storm-nigeria_f-50x33.jpg" data-sizes="(min-width: 1680px) 480px, (min-width: 1024px) calc(33vw - 64px), calc(25vw - 48px)" data-srcset="https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/HarvardPublicHealth_Books_imperfect-storm-nigeria_f.jpg 1200w, 
https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/HarvardPublicHealth_Books_imperfect-storm-nigeria_f-750x500.jpg 750w" src="https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/HarvardPublicHealth_Books_imperfect-storm-nigeria_f-50x33.jpg" />
	
	
	
</figure>
		</div>
	
	<div  class="c-card__content">

		<div class="t-story-tag c-card__meta-primary">
Book</div>

		
<h3  class="t-display-variable c-card__title" id="p-66f347881fa13-title">
	
<a  class="c-card__link" data-js="target-link" href="https://harvardpublichealth.org/policy-practice/chikwe-ihekweazu-vivianne-ihekweazu-public-health-book-review/">The resilience playbook</a>

</h3>

		<div class="t-display-variable c-card__subtitle"id="p-66f347881fa13-subtitle">
In Nigeria, fighting COVID was <em>An Imperfect Storm</em> that required creativity and optimism.</div>

		
		
		
	</div>

</article>
							
<article  class="c-card has-target-link c-card--type-post c-card--style-stacked-3up" data-js="use-target-link">

			<div  class="c-card__media">
			
<figure	 class="c-card__figure c-image"	>

	
		<img  class="c-card__image c-image__image lazyload" alt="Illustration: A figure stands on one abstract, geometric path with three other paths crossing in different directions." width="1200" height="800" data-expand="200" data-parent-fit="width" data-src="https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/HarvardPublicHealth_public-health-officer_f.jpg" srcset="https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/HarvardPublicHealth_public-health-officer_f-50x33.jpg" data-sizes="(min-width: 1680px) 480px, (min-width: 1024px) calc(33vw - 64px), calc(25vw - 48px)" data-srcset="https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/HarvardPublicHealth_public-health-officer_f.jpg 1200w, 
https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/HarvardPublicHealth_public-health-officer_f-750x500.jpg 750w" src="https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/HarvardPublicHealth_public-health-officer_f-50x33.jpg" />
	
	
	
</figure>
		</div>
	
	<div  class="c-card__content">

		<div class="t-story-tag c-card__meta-primary">
Opinion</div>

		
<h3  class="t-display-variable c-card__title" id="p-66f34788200ef-title">
	
<a  class="c-card__link" data-js="target-link" href="https://harvardpublichealth.org/policy-practice/a-public-health-officer-on-the-reality-of-principles-vs-practice/">What should we do when public health principles conflict?</a>

</h3>

		<div class="t-display-variable c-card__subtitle"id="p-66f34788200ef-subtitle">
Few decisions in the field are perfect. We must be prepared to make them anyway.</div>

		
		
		
	</div>

</article>
					</div>

					<footer class="b-post-loop__footer">

			</footer>
		
	</div>
</section>

	</article>

gform.initializeOnLoaded( function() {gformInitSpinner( 1, 'https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/plugins/gravityforms/images/spinner.svg', true );jQuery('#gform_ajax_frame_1').on('load',function(){var contents = jQuery(this).contents().find('*').html();var is_postback = contents.indexOf('GF_AJAX_POSTBACK') >= 0;if(!is_postback){return;}var form_content = jQuery(this).contents().find('#gform_wrapper_1');var is_confirmation = jQuery(this).contents().find('#gform_confirmation_wrapper_1').length > 0;var is_redirect = contents.indexOf('gformRedirect(){') >= 0;var is_form = form_content.length > 0 && ! is_redirect && ! is_confirmation;var mt = parseInt(jQuery('html').css('margin-top'), 10) + parseInt(jQuery('body').css('margin-top'), 10) + 100;if(is_form){jQuery('#gform_wrapper_1').html(form_content.html());if(form_content.hasClass('gform_validation_error')){jQuery('#gform_wrapper_1').addClass('gform_validation_error');} else {jQuery('#gform_wrapper_1').removeClass('gform_validation_error');}setTimeout( function() { /* delay the scroll by 50 milliseconds to fix a bug in chrome */  }, 50 );if(window['gformInitDatepicker']) {gformInitDatepicker();}if(window['gformInitPriceFields']) {gformInitPriceFields();}var current_page = jQuery('#gform_source_page_number_1').val();gformInitSpinner( 1, 'https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-content/plugins/gravityforms/images/spinner.svg', true );jQuery(document).trigger('gform_page_loaded', [1, current_page]);window['gf_submitting_1'] = false;}else if(!is_redirect){var confirmation_content = jQuery(this).contents().find('.GF_AJAX_POSTBACK').html();if(!confirmation_content){confirmation_content = contents;}jQuery('#gform_wrapper_1').replaceWith(confirmation_content);jQuery(document).trigger('gform_confirmation_loaded', [1]);window['gf_submitting_1'] = false;wp.a11y.speak(jQuery('#gform_confirmation_message_1').text());}else{jQuery('#gform_1').append(contents);if(window['gformRedirect']) {gformRedirect();}}jQuery(document).trigger("gform_pre_post_render", [{ formId: "1", currentPage: "current_page", abort: function() { this.preventDefault(); } }]);                if (event && event.defaultPrevented) {                return;         }        const gformWrapperDiv = document.getElementById( "gform_wrapper_1" );        if ( gformWrapperDiv ) {            const visibilitySpan = document.createElement( "span" );            visibilitySpan.id = "gform_visibility_test_1";            gformWrapperDiv.insertAdjacentElement( "afterend", visibilitySpan );        }        const visibilityTestDiv = document.getElementById( "gform_visibility_test_1" );        let postRenderFired = false;                function triggerPostRender() {            if ( postRenderFired ) {                return;            }            postRenderFired = true;            jQuery( document ).trigger( 'gform_post_render', [1, current_page] );            gform.utils.trigger( { event: 'gform/postRender', native: false, data: { formId: 1, currentPage: current_page } } );            if ( visibilityTestDiv ) {                visibilityTestDiv.parentNode.removeChild( visibilityTestDiv );            }        }        function debounce( func, wait, immediate ) {            var timeout;            return function() {                var context = this, args = arguments;                var later = function() {                    timeout = null;                    if ( !immediate ) func.apply( context, args );                };                var callNow = immediate && !timeout;                clearTimeout( timeout );                timeout = setTimeout( later, wait );                if ( callNow ) func.apply( context, args );            };        }        const debouncedTriggerPostRender = debounce( function() {            triggerPostRender();        }, 200 );        if ( visibilityTestDiv && visibilityTestDiv.offsetParent === null ) {            const observer = new MutationObserver( ( mutations ) => {                mutations.forEach( ( mutation ) => {                    if ( mutation.type === 'attributes' && visibilityTestDiv.offsetParent !== null ) {                        debouncedTriggerPostRender();                        observer.disconnect();                    }                });            });            observer.observe( document.body, {                attributes: true,                childList: false,                subtree: true,                attributeFilter: [ 'style', 'class' ],            });        } else {            triggerPostRender();        }    } );} );
</script>
					</div>

<script>
gform.initializeOnLoaded( function() {jQuery(document).trigger("gform_pre_post_render", [{ formId: "1", currentPage: "1", abort: function() { this.preventDefault(); } }]);                if (event && event.defaultPrevented) {                return;         }        const gformWrapperDiv = document.getElementById( "gform_wrapper_1" );        if ( gformWrapperDiv ) {            const visibilitySpan = document.createElement( "span" );            visibilitySpan.id = "gform_visibility_test_1";            gformWrapperDiv.insertAdjacentElement( "afterend", visibilitySpan );        }        const visibilityTestDiv = document.getElementById( "gform_visibility_test_1" );        let postRenderFired = false;                function triggerPostRender() {            if ( postRenderFired ) {                return;            }            postRenderFired = true;            jQuery( document ).trigger( 'gform_post_render', [1, 1] );            gform.utils.trigger( { event: 'gform/postRender', native: false, data: { formId: 1, currentPage: 1 } } );            if ( visibilityTestDiv ) {                visibilityTestDiv.parentNode.removeChild( visibilityTestDiv );            }        }        function debounce( func, wait, immediate ) {            var timeout;            return function() {                var context = this, args = arguments;                var later = function() {                    timeout = null;                    if ( !immediate ) func.apply( context, args );                };                var callNow = immediate && !timeout;                clearTimeout( timeout );                timeout = setTimeout( later, wait );                if ( callNow ) func.apply( context, args );            };        }        const debouncedTriggerPostRender = debounce( function() {            triggerPostRender();        }, 200 );        if ( visibilityTestDiv && visibilityTestDiv.offsetParent === null ) {            const observer = new MutationObserver( ( mutations ) => {                mutations.forEach( ( mutation ) => {                    if ( mutation.type === 'attributes' && visibilityTestDiv.offsetParent !== null ) {                        debouncedTriggerPostRender();                        observer.disconnect();                    }                });            });            observer.observe( document.body, {                attributes: true,                childList: false,                subtree: true,                attributeFilter: [ 'style', 'class' ],            });        } else {            triggerPostRender();        }    } );
</script>
		<script type="text/javascript">var omapi_localized = {
			ajax: 'https://harvardpublichealth.org/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php?optin-monster-ajax-route=1',
			nonce: '1bf64ff14f',
			slugs:
			{"rhdm2wjyigznkqtt9jil":{"slug":"rhdm2wjyigznkqtt9jil","mailpoet":false},"ry04grpjl0xshmnskrlb":{"slug":"ry04grpjl0xshmnskrlb","mailpoet":false}}		};</script>
				<script type="text/javascript">var omapi_data = {"object_id":19514,"object_key":"post","object_type":"post","term_ids":[9],"wp_json":"https:\/\/harvardpublichealth.org\/wp-json","wc_active":false,"edd_active":false,"nonce":"c0fc226c64"};</script>
		
</body>
</html>
